src.clean_data module¶

src.clean_data.clean(school_path='../data/hsls_09_school_v1_0.csv', student_path='../data/hsls_16_student_v1_0.csv')[source]¶

This method preprocesses the data for both schools and students and returns dataframe objects corresponding to each of these factors.

Returns a list of the following: Dataframe object containing school variables. Dataframe object containing student variables.

Parameters:
  • school_path (str) – Path to the school.csv file
  • student_path (str) – Path to the student.csv file
Returns:

Cleaned school and student data.
Return type:

tuple of two pandas.DataFrame

src.multivariate_methods module¶

class src.multivariate_methods.MLmodel(file_loc='/Users/wangkai/Downloads/ece229/project/ECE-229-Group5-final-project/data/student_data.csv')[source]¶

Bases: object

predict_model(input_data)[source]¶

Returns model’s prediction for the input_data.

Parameters:input_data (dict) – A dictionary with fields as keys and a scalar value or a list of values for each field, depending upon the number of samples
Returns:A 1-d numpy array with predicted y value for each sample
Return type:numpy.ndarray
train_model(y, fields, regressor=None, test_split=0)[source]¶

Train a machine learning model with y as dependent variable and variables in fields parameter as independent variables

Parameters:
  • regressor (sklearn regressor object) – If None default RandomForestRegressor is used
  • test_split (float) – If non-zero, train-test split is performed and training and test accuracy is returned else model trained on complete data and training accuracy along with -1 in place of test accuracy returned.
  • y – Dependent variable, should be numerical/continuous
  • fields (list) – List of independent variables, can be numerical or categorical
Returns:

A tuple with training accuracy and test accuracy if test_split > 0 else a tuple with training accuracy and -1 in place of test accuracy.
Return type:

tuple
src.multivariate_methods.get_correlation_matrix(fields, file_loc='/Users/wangkai/Downloads/ece229/project/ECE-229-Group5-final-project/data/student_data.csv', method='pearson')[source]¶

Computes correlation matrix that captures correlation between features present in the fields parameter

Parameters:
  • fields (list) – List of fields
  • file_loc (str) – Path to the dataset
  • method – Method of correlation
  • pearson : standard correlation coefficient
  • kendall : Kendall Tau correlation coefficient
  • spearman : Spearman rank correlation
Returns:Correlation matrix.
Return type:pandas.DataFrame
src.multivariate_methods.get_feature_importance(y, fields, file_loc='/Users/wangkai/Downloads/ece229/project/ECE-229-Group5-final-project/data/student_data.csv', method='pearson')[source]¶

Computes feature importance of all the variables in fields parameter with dependent y variable. For categorical fields, it provides results from anova analysis and for numerical/continuous fields it returns correlation coefficients with y.

Parameters:method – Method of correlation
  • pearson : standard correlation coefficient
  • kendall : Kendall Tau correlation coefficient
  • spearman : Spearman rank correlation
Parameters:
  • file_loc (str) – path to dataset
  • fields (list) – list of field ids where each field id is a string
  • y (str) – a dependent y field id
Returns:

A multilevel dictionary, value corresponding to key ‘category’ contains a dictionary with anova results for categorical fields and value for key ‘continuous’ is dictionary with correlation coefficients.
Return type:

dict

Get variable information

  1. Single variable: get_var_info("N1ALTCERT")
  2. Batch variables: get_var_info(["N1ALTCERT", "N1COURSE"])
Parameters:file_loc (str) – Path to the dataset
Returns:A pd.DataFrame associated with the variable or a subset of pd.DataFrame corresponds to each variable in name.
